title: BrAPI2ISA
description: The BrAPI2ISA service functions as a converter between a BrAPI-compatible server and the ISA-Tab format.

title: snpclust
description: The “snpclust” tool enables a user to check and manually correct the clustering of fluorescence based SNP genotyping data.

title: ShinyBrAPPs
description: The ShinyBrAPPs code repository contains a number of useful tools, built using the R-Shiny framework and the BrAPI R open source library.

title: Sugarcane Crossing Tool (SCT)
description: The Sugarcane Crossing Tool (SCT) is a lightweight R-Shiny dashboard application designed to receive, process, and visualize data from a linked BreedBase11 instance.

title: G-Crunch
description: G-Crunch is an upcoming user-facing tool to make simple, repeatable analysis requests.

title: MGIS
description: The Musa Germplasm Information System (MGIS) contains key information on Musa germplasm diversity, including passport data, botanical classification, morpho-taxonomic descriptors, molecular studies, plant photographs and GIS information

title: Florilège
description: Florilège is a web portal designed primarily for the general public to access public plant genetic resources held by Biological Resource Centers across France. Through this portal, users can browse accessions from over 50 plant genera, spread across 19 genebanks.

team: Leibniz Institute of Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research (IPK), Bioinformatics and Information Technology (BIT)
title: AGENT
description: AGENT aims to unlock the full potential of the biological material stored in gene banks around the globe by using FAIR international data standards and an open digital infrastructure for the management of plant genetic resources.

title: Practical Haplotype Graph (PHG)
description: The Practical Haplotype Graph (PHG) is a graph-based computational framework that represents large-scale genetic variation and is optimized for plant breeding and genetics.

title: DArTView
description: DArTView is a desktop application for marker data curation via metadata filtering. DArTView enables genotype variant data visualization designed such that users can easily identify trends or correlations within their data.

title: Trait Selector BrAPP
description: The BrAPI Trait Selector application provides a user interface to filter germplasm according to their trait. The user interface is composed by an SVG image representing a plant of interest and a javascript application that manages user actions.

title: PIPPA
description: PIPPA, the PSB Interface for Plant Phenotype Analysis, is the central web interface and database that provides the tools for the management of the plant imaging robots on the one hand, and the analysis of images and data on the other hand.

title: ImageBreed
description: ImageBreed helps you manage field trials, process imaging events, and perform genotypically informed predictions.

title: ClimMob
description: ClimMob is software for agricultural citizen science with the following features: 1) Organize large-scale experiments. 2) Invite participation of thousands of volunteering citizen scientists: farmers, consumers and others. 3) Test different technology options, such as crop varieties, food products, or agronomic practices. 4) Streamline the experimental cycle with electronic forms and barcodes. 5) Get quick insights from extensive automatic reports. 6) Use a suite of open-source tools to gain in-depth understanding trends and patterns.

title: BrAPI Germplasm Search Tool
description: Enter a list of germplasm names and find matching germplasm records on a BrAPI-compliant database using different search routines that can find matches with variations in spelling, punctuation, etc in the database names and/or synonyms. The user can then select matches and download lists of the matches and/or missing records.

title: qrlabelr: Generate Machine- And Human-Readable Plot Labels for Experiments
description: A no-frills open-source solution for designing plot labels affixed with QR codes. It features 'EasyQrlabelr', a 'shiny' app that simplifies the process of plot label design for non-R users.

title: BrAPIMapper
description: A docker (compose) project that enables a complete BrAPI implementation on almost any type of data source once a data mapping is set on the included mapping interface.

team: Leibniz Institute of Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research (IPK), Bioinformatics and Information Technology (BIT)
title: DivBrowse
description: DivBrowse is a software for interactive visualization and analysis of the diversity of genomic variants. It uses VCF and GFF3 files as data input and consists of a web server written in Python and a GUI written in Javascript. It is available as a Python package on PyPI.org and also as Docker image.

team: Leibniz Institute of Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research (IPK), Bioinformatics and Information Technology (BIT)
title: MIRA
description: Phenotyping datasets are often available as MIAPPE compliant ISA Tab in repositories. However, the programmatic use of those datasets is limited. To enable access to such data products, MIRA is transforming them and provides BrAPI endpoints accordingly. This allows developers to use the data products in their applications.

team: CIRAD, IRD and Alliance Bioversity CIAT
title: GIGWA
description: Gigwa, a web-based tool which provides an easy and intuitive way to explore large amounts of genotyping data by filtering the latter based not only on variant features, including functional annotations, but also on genotype patterns. GIGWA can work as a BrAPI source and client.

title: DeltaBreed
description: DeltaBreed is a user friendly interface designed to support USDA-ARS specialty crop and animal breeders to load, view, and retrieve breeding data.

title: Helium
description: Helium provides a BrAPI enabled visualization platform for plant pedigree data.

title: GridScore
description: GridScore is a cross-platform open-source plant phenotyping app combining a visual view of the field layout with barcode system compatibility and a guided data collection approach allowing step-by-step collection of phenotypic data, supported by a set of powerful visualizations.

title: PHIS
description: The open-source Phenotyping Hybrid Information System (PHIS), based on OpenSILEX, manages and collects data from Phenotyping and High Throughput Phenotyping experiments on a day to day basis. It can store, organize and manage highly heterogeneous (e.g. images, spectra, growth curves) and multi-spatial and temporal scale data (leaf to canopy level) originating from multiple sources (field, greenhouse). It unambiguously identifies all objects and traits in an experiment and establishes their relations via ontologies and semantics that apply to both field and controlled conditions. Its ontology-driven architecture is a powerful tool for integrating and managing data from multiple experiments and platforms, for creating relationships between objects and enriching datasets with knowledge and metadata. It is MIAPPE and BrAPI compliant, and naming conventions are recommended for users to declare their resources. Several experimental platforms use PHIS to manage their data, and PHIS instances dedicated to sharing resources (projects, genetic resources, variables) also exist to allow the sharing of studied concepts.

title: Flapjack
description: Flapjack is a multi-platform application providing interactive visualizations of high-throughput genotype data, allowing for rapid navigation and comparisons between lines, markers and chromosomes.

title: DArT Genotyping Services
description: You can order DNA analysis and laboratory services from DArT through BrAPI

title: Cornell Genotyping Services
description: You can order DNA analysis and laboratory services from Cornell BRC through BrAPI

title: Germinate
description: Germinate provides a fully featured open-source plant genetic resources platform.

title: BIMS
description: Breeding Information Management System (BIMS) is a free, open-source, secure and online breeding management system which allows breeders to store, manage, archive and analyze their private breeding program data.

title: QBMS
description: Breeders can use this R package to Query the Breeding Management System(s) like BMS, BreeBase, and GIGWA (using BrAPI calls) and help them to retrieve phenotypic and genotypic data directly into their analyzing pipelines developed in R statistical environment.

title: HortControl
description: HortControl is the central software to setup, visualize and analyze your PlantEye measurements. Designed to be used by staff with any professional background with a user friendly interface. You can access HortControl from your office or in the field.

title: BrAPI Node Server
description: This is an implementation of BrAPI using NodeJS. It is being developed by the Portuguese Node within the context of ELIXIR-EXCELERATE.

title: JHI BrAPI Java
description: BrAPI Java is a Breeding API (BrAPI) implementation written in Java. It contains all data objects as well as a client interface that can be utilized using Retrofit and server interfaces that are designed to be used with the Restlet library.

title: ARDN
description: The Agricultural Research Data Network (ARDN) provides tools and protocols to allow researchers to not only share their data, but to make their data interoperable and reusable.

title: GRIN-Global
description: The GRIN-Global project's mission is to provide a scalable version of the Germplasm Resource Information Network (GRIN) suitable for use by any interested genebank in the world.

title: FAIDARE
description: FAIR Data-finder for Agronomic REsearch

title: GLIS DOI Registration Service
team: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
description: The DOI Registration Service of the GLobal Information System (GLIS) assigns Digital Object Identifiers (DOIs) to Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture (PGRFA) for reference in third party systems and scientific literature.

title: Field Book
description: Field Book is a simple app for taking phenotypic notes. Field Book was created to replace paper field books and to enable increased collection speed with greater data integrity.

title: Breeding Management System (BMS)
description: The Breeding Management System (BMS) is a data management software specifically designed to meet the needs of modern plant breeders.

title: Breedbase
description: Breedbase

title: Mr.Bean
description: Mr.Bean is an easy to use R-Shiny web-app that simplifies the analysis of large-scale plant breeding experimental analysis by using the power and versatility of Linear Mixed Models (LMM).

title: BrAPI-Sync
description: Built by the IBP Team, this tool allows for the automated transfer of data between BrAPI compliant systems.

title: Flapjack-Bytes
description: Flapjack-Bytes is a graphical genotype visualization library. The visualization is modelled on the pre-existing Java desktop application Flapjack.

title: BrAPI Fieldmap
description: Built by the IBP Team, this is a fully BrAPI compliant tool for editing field spatial layout using GeoJson information.

title: Graphical Filtering Tool
description: Built by BreedBase, this is a fully BrAPI compliant tool for graphically building complex search and filter queries of Observational Data.

title: Variable Ontology Widget
description: Built by URGI - INRA, this is a JavaScript widget displaying all the observation variables of a BrAPI endpoint.

title: Study Comparison Tool
description: Built by BreedBase, this is a fully BrAPI compliant tool for comparing the performance of germplasm across studies.

title: Pedigree Viewer
description: Built by BreedBase, this is a fully BrAPI compliant tool for viewing and exploring germplasm pedigrees.

title: Beegmac
description: Brapi-Enabled Embeddable Genomic-Marker Allele Client

title: Comparative Map Viewer
description: Comparative Map Viewer, this is a fully BrAPI compliant tool for viewing and comparing genetic maps
